web.subtitle: Web Development
web.name: web
web.description: Web development is my professional development area, it is something I took up to assist in a previous workplace alongside my regular Software Development role, which I found to take on quite well and enjoyed, so fully made the move a few months later to pursue the new role, yet full-time with the same company.

replications.name: Replications
replications.excerpt: A group of projects that I have replicated from other websites, to help me learn and understand how they work.
replications.description: A group of projects that I have replicated from other websites, to help me learn and understand how they work. Using modern CSS Frameworks such as Bootstrap and TailwindCSS, I am replicating a number of websites layouts and styles, such websites include Spotify, Netflix, Amazon, Twitter and more, over time these will be added to the site and will be available to view.

gallery.name: Gallery
gallery.excerpt: An introduction to Object-Oriented PHP, by Edwin Diaz, available on Udemy.

amplify.name: Amplify
amplify.excerpt: A follow along project replicating Spotify 2017, by Reece Kenney, available on Udemy.
amplify.description:
During my time refining my object-oriented programming skills, I decided to follow along with a project course, in which I followed along in creating a copy of Spotify 2017, a music streaming service. I wanted to create a service that would allow users to create their own playlists and listen to their music.


To create this project, I used PHP, MySQL, CSS, JavaScript and AJAX. I used PHP to create the backend of the website, which would handle the user authentication and the database queries. I used MySQL to store the data for the website, which would store the user information, the songs and the playlists. I used CSS to style the website, which would allow the website to look almost identical to that which I was replicating, with minor changes for personal styling choices. I used JavaScript to create the front-end of the website, which would allow the user to interact with the website. I used AJAX to create the asynchronous requests to the server, which would allow the website to be more responsive.

blog.name: Blog
blog.excerpt: An ongoing development into designing a blog website while utilizing Laravel.

igdb.name: IGDB
igdb.excerpt: An ongoing development into creating a video game aggregator using a 3rd party API in a project.
igdb.description: IGBD is a video game aggregator, which allows users to search for video games and view information about them. The project is currently in development. The project is being created using the IGDB API, which is a 3rd party API.

parallax.name: Parallax
parallax.excerpt: A look into Parallax Scrolling, an effect which can look great when utilised correctly.
